definition: not to fight back/to take it lying down/to show weakness/to show one's softer side
to show/to reveal
weak/feeble/young/inferior/(following a decimal or fraction) slightly less than
not to be outdone

sentences.english: And it also sends a message of weakness internationally.
sentences.chinese: 這也讓我們在國際上發出了示弱的信息。

sentences.english: Employees in high spirits, and actively enthusiastic, each one not to be outdone.
sentences.chinese: 員工們興致勃勃，積極踊躍，每一個都不甘示弱。

sentences.english: Not to be outdone, the Xu family to say the address.
sentences.chinese: 不甘示弱的徐某說出自家的地址。

sentences.english: Chen also don't fiddle, throwing the ball out, did not result in.
sentences.chinese: 小陳也不甘示弱，把球投了出去，結果沒有進。

sentences.english: Looking away wil signa to your cat that you are weak, and an attack is likely to follow.
sentences.chinese: 挪開視線是示弱的信號，於是它可能會欺負你。

sentences.english: Modern men still carry the ancient legacy of being brave and showing no weaknesses.
sentences.chinese: 現代的男人依然承襲着勇敢和不示弱的古老傳統。

sentences.english: We dare not tempt them with weakness.
sentences.chinese: 我們不敢以示弱去誘惑他們。

sentences.english: Saudi Arabia’s conservatives are not so cowed.
sentences.chinese: 沙特阿拉伯的保守派也不甘示弱。

sentences.english: Hang handsome looking for xian zhen said he would make a malicious things, two people do not show weakness.
sentences.chinese: 亨俊找熙貞說自己也會做出狠事，兩人都不示弱。

sentences.english: And when the international community shows hesitation, this is being perceived as weakness.
sentences.chinese: 當國際社會顯得猶豫不決時，這會被認爲是在示弱。

definition: not to be outdone
to move aside/to get out of the way/to back down/to concede
to admit defeat/to give in/to acknowledge a mistake/to apologize/to be amenable to persuasion
to concede/to admit defeat/to admit sth is wrong after insisting it is right
to follow up a victory and press home the attack/to pursue retreating enemy
to concede/to admit defeat
to hit back/to return fire
to strike back/to beat back/to counterattack
to shrink back/to cower
to be willing to/to resign oneself to
to express goodwill/to be friendly
to gain the initiative by striking first (idiom); to preempt/to anticipate/preemptive
(military) offensive
to provoke/provocation
to fight back/to return fire/to counterattack
to concede/to give in/to yield/a concession/(linguistics) concessive
